meanings.definition: The quality or state of being literal.
meanings.sent1: Her literalness in interpreting instructions made her a reliable employee.
meanings.sent2: The literalness of his speech made it easy for everyone to understand.
meanings.sent3: His literalness in following the recipe to the letter resulted in a surprisingly delicious dish.
meanings.sent4: The literalness of the painting captured every detail of the landscape perfectly.
meanings.sent5: The literalness of the map helped us navigate through the forest without getting lost.

meanings.definition: The adherence to the explicit or primary meaning of a word or phrase.
meanings.sent1: The student's literalness in defining the terms impressed the teacher.
meanings.sent2: His literalness in understanding idioms sometimes led to confusion.
meanings.sent3: The literalness of his response to the joke made everyone burst into laughter.
meanings.sent4: Her literalness in translating the ancient text preserved its original meaning.
meanings.sent5: The literalness of the contract left no room for misinterpretation.

meanings.definition: The exact representation of a subject.
meanings.sent1: The artist's literalness in capturing the model's features amazed the viewers.
meanings.sent2: The literalness of the sculpture made it look almost lifelike.
meanings.sent3: His literalness in drawing the cartoon character made it come to life on paper.
meanings.sent4: The literalness of the photograph preserved the moment for eternity.
meanings.sent5: The literalness of the description painted a vivid picture in the reader's mind.
